page.title: 02DUNSMOUTH FARM NEAR BUDE
page.content: Dunsmouth Farm is 218 acres in size.It has 100 cattle (mainly Friesians), 4 rams, 100 ewes, and grows barley and hay.Milk is taken in a small tank-trailer to Grenville Gate to a {Milk Marketing Board}lorry.The farm is a partnership of 3 families and has 9 buildings, 4 tractors, a combine harvester, 2 trailers, a silager and a bailer.There are no sewers, mains gas or electricity but there are septic tanks and a generator.Fresh water was introduced to the farm in 1981.Near the farm there is a{circular tumulus} which the farmer is not allowed to plough.In one field there are the remains of a World War 2{rifle range} used by American troops preparing for the{1944 Normandy Invasion.
